intro: Gluta orgyalis, commonly known as the golden gluta, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have a rough texture with a dark green upper surface. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its natural distribution in tropical regions.
